author: William Emerson
text: In a recent recruitment, I was confused by one of the screening criteria, “Do not have any break(s) in service - voluntary or involuntary – in their professional history.”  Managers are fired for a multitude of reasons, many of which have nothing to do with the manager’s competence, e.g., political expediency, unethical behavior by a council member or by the Council as a whole, change in community dynamics, etc.  Is this a common criterion?  If so, what underlies councils’ thinking on the issue? Thanks!
title: City/Town Manager Recruitment Criteria
